DOC.brief_summary: Atelectasis involving declive areas often occurs during general anesthesia and may persist postoperatively. This phenomenon could be amplified by pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg position. Hypothesis: To evaluate whether the shape of the airway pressure-time curve, Stress Index (SI), during constant flow inflation can lead ventilator setting during general anesthesia.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of Ventilatory Strategies During Laparoscopic Surgery
DOC.criteria: American Society Anesthesiology (ASA) I, II; age > 18 years; elective surgery ASA III, IV; Age < 18 years; emergency surgery
